newsitem.title: ITALY: Prodi sees real possibility Italy in EMU at start.
newsitem.headline: Prodi sees real possibility Italy in EMU at start.

text.p: Prime Minister Romano Prodi said it was realistic to forecast that Italy will be in the first group of nations entering European economic and monetary union.

"There are concrete and real possibilities to be in the first group of countries to form the single currency...all the conditions are there for Italy to be in the leading group," he told the annual congress of the CISL trades union confederation.
"At the moment we are only missing one Maastricht parameter, that on debt and for which it is difficult to do anything, but a year ago we were out on four of the five criteria," Prodi said.
Prodi reiterated that he had confidence in an economic recovery even though he was not 100 percent certain of it.

"I am confident but without being sure. I think the economy should grow again on solid foundations because all recoveries have started from action to overhaul the economy like that we have taken this year," Prodi said, referring to the corrective budgetary measures worth some 100 trillion lire his centre-left government has so far passed.
"These enormous sacrifices have contributed to braking growth but now we are ready for recovery," he added.
